title: invalid member of stdlib
body:
![screenshot 34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37961895/50541869-d79eed80-0bd4-11e9-85fb-bbc51b37e033.png)
![screenshot 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37961895/50541870-d79eed80-0bd4-11e9-82c3-cc4cb24b7e88.png)
when i am trying to run 'node compile.js' it its showing "  (node:10152) V8: C:\Users\Akash\chat\node_modules\solc\soljson.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib  " and even when i run ' npm run test ' its showing an error " PS C:\Users\Akash\chat> node compile.js
(node:10152) V8: C:\Users\Akash\chat\node_modules\solc\soljson.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib
PS C:\Users\Akash\chat> npm run  test

> chat@1.0.0 test C:\Users\Akash\chat
> mocha



(node:1432) V8: C:\Users\Akash\chat\node_modules\solc\soljson.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib
  inbox
    1) "before each" hook for "deploys a contract"


  0 passing (115ms)
  1 failing

  1) "before each" hook for "deploys a contract":
     TypeError: (intermediate value).deploy(...).sent is not a function
      at Context.beforeEach (test\inbox.test.js:17:4)



npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! chat@1.0.0 test: `mocha`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the chat@1.0.0 test script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     C:\Users\Akash\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_logs\2018-12-29T20_20_39_579Z-debug.log
PS C:\Users\Akash\chat> "  
Can anyone give me a solution?

any idea why we get `node_modules\solc\soljson.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib`
@axic @chriseth  ?

> any idea why we get `node_modules\solc\soljson.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib`
> @axic @chriseth ?

I am also getting same message while i do any execution. Is this any form of error?
Can you try a different version of nodejs?

Seems like this issue goes back months:
- https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/45986/invalid-asm-js-invalid-member-of-stdlib-when-loading-remix-ide?rq=1 (with 0.4.21)
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53812766/invalid-asm-js-invalid-member-of-stdlib (with 0.4.17)

According to https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=771563:
> If you are getting this "Invalid member of stdlib" message, it means that your module is not validating, and it is going through the normal JS pipeline.
> Does your module verify without problems on Firefox?

It seems it maybe a V8 (Chrome, Node) issue. Though that thread says it should work, albeit slowly.
@akashde93 can you tell us the solc version you are using?

> @akashde93 can you tell us the solc version you are using?

i am using Solidity v0.4.18 (solc-js)

> Can you try a different version of nodejs?

i am using v11.5.0 of node js
Any luck on this problem anyone? I am having the same issue when running command: solcjs contractname.sol --bin --abi --optimize -o <output-dir>/

same here using macos, node v11.11.0, solc@0.4.25 and Chrome 73.0.3683.86.

Any updates/fixes on this bug?
is there something we should do for fixing that? @axic @chriseth

After trying a million different things to fix this error (reinstalling node_modules, re-cloning projects, playing with mocha/solc versions), I found that updating my Node.js version from 11.x to 12.2 (the current stable version as of May 17, 2019) did the trick. Running on MacOS 10.14 Mojave.

i have the same error 

> any idea why we get `node_modules\solc\soljson.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib`
> @axic @chriseth ?

> After trying a million different things to fix this error (reinstalling node_modules, re-cloning projects, playing with mocha/solc versions), I found that updating my Node.js version from 11.x to 12.2 (the current stable version as of May 17, 2019) did the trick. Running on MacOS 10.14 Mojave.

broo it still doesn't work
Same as @E-Haroun , @jenklu 's solution (upgrading from nodejs 11 to 12) doesn't resolve this on my side. But, for nodejs 10, it doesn't yield any warning nor error.

install specific version 12 helped me:
sudo pacman -Sy "nodejs=12.18.3"
I have this issue just now. I hope a definite solution is coming soon. It's already 2021. 🙏 Thank you guys for all your hard work!

> I have this issue just now. I hope a definite solution is coming soon. It's already 2021. 🙏 Thank you guys for all your hard work!

Just install node 12.18.3, worked for me.

> > I have this issue just now. I hope a definite solution is coming soon. It's already 2021. pray Thank you guys for all your hard work!
> 
> Just install node 12.18.3, worked for me.

i have node v14.15.4 but i still have the same error

I've got node v14.16 and get this error : 
Compilation failed. See above.
(node:18916) V8: C:\Users\r0yce\.config\truffle\compilers\node_modules\soljson-v0.4.15+commit.bbb8e64f.js:3 Invalid asm.js: Invalid member of stdlib, so frustrating =(

I got the same error when I tried to migrate my contracts but what worked for me was to change the port number in truffle.js to the port number of the ganache workspace. I don't know if this helps but  hope it can help somebody

same issue guys, is changing the node version the only solution?
if yes, could anyone get me the installable node version 12 file link
man< i have tried so many things. Nothing seems to work. I have tried, changing node versions, checking the pragma syntax, installing nvm, If anyone has any suggestions please help!!!!!

HEY guys I was able to figure out the issue for myself. Basically use node version 10.0.0     If this doesnt work then you prolly have a typo.     But to use an old version of node , i first installed NVM-node version manager. Once you download that, on your terminal you can run "nvm use 10".    Just like that, that means you are trying to use node version 10. nvm should notify you that you are veriosn 10, after that u r good. if you get into trouble, message me at my webstie mandodev.com

Hey guys, 
for me changing the solidity compiler version solved the issue.
I arbitrarily picked:
npm install solc@0.4.26

> Hey guys, for me changing the solidity compiler version solved the issue. I arbitrarily picked: npm install solc@0.4.26

Thanks @Eloneron ! Works now for me as well. 

Don't forget to update truffle-config.js in your truffle project. FYI, I'm running node 16.3.0,

> Hey guys, for me changing the solidity compiler version solved the issue. I arbitrarily picked: npm install solc@0.4.26

works for me as well cause of this
Sweeeet found it. and did it!!! thanks Crew/fam
Thanks Elonron Great
